page.title: 06Dalkeith Arts Centre
page.content: Built in conjunction with a modern shopping centre the library and arts centre, in Buccleuch Street, provide facilities second to none in relation to the size of the town. Although within the one building, the arts centre is operated independently of the library although both come under the jurisdiction of the Recreation and Leisure Department of Midlothian District Council. The library is spacious and well-equipped with books, records and show cases. The arts centre can be divided into two parts and is a favourite place for coffee mornings as well as exhibitions and concerts. One of the best places in Scotland makes possible the presentation of first rate concerts.
